      • withAtMost

        public LimitConstraintBuilder<T> withAtMost(int limit)

      • inTableWithPostfix

        public SearchableClassConstraintBuilder<T> inTableWithPostfix(String tablePostfix)
        Sets the table to look for. This is only possible in case searched element is over a federated table. Element is thus searched from only one sigle table, whose name is the original table, postfixed by the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        tablePostfix - the table to look for has to have the given postfix (can be "" for original table)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - in case this class is not over a federated table
        IllegalArgumentException - in case this table cannot be part of the federation for searched class (i.e. it does not starts with original table name)
        IllegalArgumentException - in case a different table was already set in the query

      • getConstraint

        public Constraint getConstraint()
        Overrides:
        getConstraint in class ClassConstraintBuilder<T extends PersistingElement>

      • andActivate

        public SearchableClassConstraintBuilder<T> andActivate(String... families)
        Requests for some more family activations while executing the query, in addition to simple properties and families marked as ImplicitActivation.
        Parameters:
        families - the names of the families to be activated (i.e. name of the Map or Set property).

      • andActivateAllFamilies

        public SearchableClassConstraintBuilder<T> andActivateAllFamilies()
        Activate all known families for this class (see ConstraintBuilder.ofClass(Class)). Please note that only column families for this class (or inherited) are activated, and not families for subclasses, even if found elements are instance of a subclass for this class. This remark does not hold for properties, which are all activated, regardless of the fact they are declared in this class or in a subclass.

      • withId

        public T withId(String id)
         throws DatabaseNotReachedException
        Finds the element with the given id. Any limit set by withAtMost(int) will be ignored. Specified column families are activated if not already (i.e. this element is already known by this thread) (see PersistingElement.activateIfNotAlready(String...)) ; you should rather perform an PersistingElement.activate(String...) without specifying any column family with andActivate(String...) to force activation.
        Parameters:
        id - non printable character string
        Returns:
        element with given id and class ; null if not found
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • go

        public NavigableSet<T> go()
                   throws DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find at most N matching elements. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Elements activated (see andActivate(String...)), and their keys are all loaded into memory.
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of elements matching the query limited to the maximum limit.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • iterate

        public CloseableIterator<T> iterate()
                             throws DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find at most N matching elements. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Elements activated (see andActivate(String...)). Instead of this function, you should consider using forEach(Process).
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of elements matching the query limited to the maximum limit, that has to be closed once performed.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • any

        public T any()
      throws DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find an element matching the query. Any limit set by withAtMost(int) will be ignored (as it is considered to be 1). The element is activated according to declared column families (see andActivate(String...)).
        Returns:
        A (possibly null) element matching the query.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • count

        public long count()
           throws DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find the number of matching elements. Any limit set by withAtMost(int) will be ignored.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • withKey

        public SearchableKeyConstraintBuilder<T> withKey(String key)

      • andWithKey

        public SearchableKeyConstraintBuilder<T> andWithKey(String key)

      • forEach

        public Process.ProcessReport<T> forEach(Process<T> action)
                                 throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                                        InterruptedException,
                                        ProcessException
        Performs an action for each element corresponding to the query. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int).
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed over each element of the query.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        InterruptedException - in case threads are interrupted or timeout is reached
        ProcessException - in case some process sent an exception while running

      • forEach

        public Process.ProcessReport<T> forEach(Process<T> action,
                                        int threadNumber,
                                        long timeoutMs)
                                 throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                                        InterruptedException,
                                        ProcessException
        Performs an action for each element corresponding to the query using parallel threads. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Invoking this method is blocking until execution is completed.
        In case you only use one thread, process will be performed in this thread.
        Be aware that process will not use cache for the current thread, and as such you might need to PersistingElement.activate(String...) elements stored in the process to see changes.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed over each element of the query.
        threadNumber - the maximum number of concurrent threads
        timeoutMs - the max allowed time to execute this task ; useless in case threadNumber is 1
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        InterruptedException - in case threads are interrupted or timeout is reached
        ProcessException - in case some process sent an exception while running

      • forEach

        public Process.ProcessReport<T> forEach(Process<T> action,
                                        int threadNumber,
                                        ProcessCanceller canceller)
                                 throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                                        InterruptedException,
                                        ProcessException
        Performs an action for each element corresponding to the query using parallel threads. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Invoking this method is blocking until execution is completed.
        In case you only use one thread, process will be performed in this thread.
        Be aware that process will not use cache for the current thread, and as such you might need to PersistingElement.activate(String...) elements stored in the process to see changes.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed over each element of the query.
        threadNumber - the maximum number of concurrent threads
        canceller - a canceller object regularly observed while performing request ; in case this object responds false after invoked ProcessCanceller.isCancelled(), this methods returns a ProcessException with message found by ProcessCanceller.getErrorMessage(Process)
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        InterruptedException - in case threads are interrupted or canceler responds false to ProcessCanceller.isCancelled()
        ProcessException - in case some process sent an exception while running

      • forEach

        public Process.ProcessReport<T> forEach(Process<T> action,
                                        int threadNumber,
                                        long timeoutMs,
                                        ExecutorService executor)
                                 throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                                        InterruptedException,
                                        ProcessException
        Performs an action for each element corresponding to the query using parallel threads ; method might return before process is ended. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Invoking this method can be blocking as long as threadNumber is less that the number of elements to be treated.
        Be aware that process will not use cache for the current thread, and as such you might need to PersistingElement.activate(String...) elements stored in the process to see changes.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed over each element of the query.
        threadNumber - the maximum number of concurrent threads
        timeoutMs - the max allowed time to execute this task ; useless in case threadNumber is 1
        executor - the executor to run process ; you need to call ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to be sure that all elements are processed ; if null, this method is equivalent to forEach(Process, int, long)
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        InterruptedException - in case threads are interrupted or timeout is reached
        ProcessException - in case some process sent an exception while running

      • forEach

        public Process.ProcessReport<T> forEach(Process<T> action,
                                        int threadNumber,
                                        ProcessCanceller canceller,
                                        ExecutorService executor)
                                 throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                                        InterruptedException,
                                        ProcessException
        Performs an action for each element corresponding to the query using parallel threads ; method might return before process is ended. The maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Invoking this method can be blocking as long as threadNumber is less that the number of elements to be treated.
        Be aware that process will not use cache for the current thread, and as such you might need to PersistingElement.activate(String...) elements stored in the process to see changes.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed over each element of the query.
        threadNumber - the maximum number of concurrent threads
        canceller - a canceller object regularly observed while performing request ; in case this object responds false after invoked ProcessCanceller.isCancelled(), this methods returns a ProcessException with message found by ProcessCanceller.getErrorMessage(Process)
        executor - the executor to run process ; you need to call ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to be sure that all elements are processed ; if null, this method is equivalent to forEach(Process, int, long)
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        InterruptedException - in case threads are interrupted or canceler responds false to ProcessCanceller.isCancelled()
        ProcessException - in case some process sent an exception while running

      • remoteForEach

        public void remoteForEach(Process<T> action,
                          Callback callBack,
                          int threadNumber,
                          long timeout)
                   throws DatabaseNotReachedException,
                          InstantiationException,
                          IllegalAccessException
        Performs asynchronously an action for each element corresponding to the query. In case store for class is not implementing ActionnableStore, this action is equivalent to an asynchronous call to forEach(Process), and the maximum limit N must be set before using withAtMost(int). Otherwise, the action is performed directly using the data store server process, and the limit is useless. In order to wait for process completion, you can use WaitingCallBack.
        Parameters:
        action - class of the action to be performed over each element of the query ; must have a default constructor
        callBack - a callback to be invoked as soon as the process completes ; can be null
        timeout - in case store does not support ActionnableStore
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotReachedException
        IllegalAccessException
        InstantiationException

      • exportTo

        public long exportTo(ObjectOutputStream out)
              throws IOException,
                     DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find at most N matching elements and serialize a representation into the output stream. The maximum limit N can be set before using withAtMost(int), but is not mandatory. Dependencies are not serialized. Consider carefully setting families to be activated before ; it is advised to use andActivateAllFamilies(). Implementation tries to optimize as much as possible memory impact.
        Parameters:
        out - an output stream that must support InputStream.markSupported() ; note that only one ObjectOutputStream must be created for a given OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException
        DatabaseNotReachedException

      • exportTo

        public long exportTo(String file)
              throws IOException,
                     DatabaseNotReachedException
        Runs the query to find at most N matching elements and serialize a representation into the output stream. The maximum limit N can be set before using withAtMost(int), but is not mandatory. Dependencies are not serialized. Consider carefully setting families to be activated before ; it is advised to use andActivateAllFamilies(). Implementation tries to optimize as much as possible memory impact.
        Parameters:
        file - the file where elements are to be stored ; overwritten if exists
        Throws:
        IOException
        DatabaseNotReachedException
